channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Amazon CTO’s 2026 tech predictions include the dawn of the ‘renaissance developer’: ‘You need polymaths like Da Vinci’
item.description: Vogels says his annual list of tech predictions is more optimistic than it may seem.

item.title: For caregivers, Thanksgiving is no break at all
item.description: You’re probably winding down from work and getting ready for a few days at home with your family. But anybody with caregiving responsibility knows tha...

item.title: Spanx Founder Sara Blakely Swears These 7 Words Built Her Success—and Most Leaders Avoid Them
item.description: How a simple question shaped Sara Blakely’s resilience—and how it can transform the way your team takes risks.

item.title: Wall Street is on tenterhooks over the Fed’s ‘rare, genuinely suspenseful’ December meeting—the committee is unsure of the data, and each other
item.description: A divided Fed meets amid mixed jobs and inflation signals, leaving Powell with a suspenseful December.

item.title: How women business owners can use networking to close the capital and mentorship gap
item.description: When I launched my first business in my twenties, I thought success meant doing everything alone. I believed that if I worked hard enough, read every ...

item.title: The crazy story of how Ring founder Jamie Siminoff secured the name ‘Ring.com’
item.description: In his new book Ding Dong: How Ring Went from Shark Tank Reject to Everyone’s Front Door , Ring founder Jamie Siminoff pulls back the curtain on the c...

item.title: How Costco Turns Loss Leaders Into an Art Form (And Why Your Business Might Want to Copy Them)
item.description: Just because it’s simple to explain doesn’t mean it’s easy to execute.

item.title: AI Dynamic Pricing Is Perfect For Companies That Want to Lose Customers
item.description: The good news is they’ll definitely make a few extra dollars along the way.

item.title: How to introduce AI to a skeptical workplace
item.description: Chris was frustrated. He’d used Artificial Intelligence ( AI ) extensively in college. Now at his first job, he saw very few of his colleagues ever ex...

item.title: Steve Jobs Said This is When Great Bosses Say ‘I,’ Not ‘We’
item.description: Granted, we’re taught to say ‘we.’ But Jobs felt there were times ‘I’ is the only pronoun you should use.

item.title: Deloitte just got caught again citing fabricated and AI-generated research—this time in a million-dollar report for the Canadian government
item.description: In a healthcare report aimed to address a nurse and doctor shortage, Deloitte cited several fake studies with real researchers’ names attached.

item.title: Global e-commerce startup funding hits 2020s low, while 2025 U.S. holiday spending could break records
item.description: In 2021, global e-commerce-related startup funding peaked, but in 2025 those numbers have come crashing down to around $7 billion for the year, per Cr...

item.title: The real AI threat is algorithms that ‘enrage to engage’

item.title: Amazon CTO Werner Vogels just released his 2026 tech predictions. He’s most optimistic about ‘personalized learning’ and ‘renaissance developers’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Why You Should Swap Scrolling Social Media for an ‘Analog Bag’
item.description: Yes, it’s ironic, but the new TikTok trend of ‘analog bags’ really can help you have a saner, healthier relationship to social media.
